There was all the hype for this new webmail service by Google, also the owners of Blogger. Seems like they are doing everything right. I have been trying out this new account and at first glance it seems like your everyday webmail (ie hotmail, yahoomail) but it is different. What's the diff? It doesn't have folders but filters. It uses search more effectively (or so they claim), and it has the "conversation" feature where you can see the thread or history of the emails. But what stands out for me is the speed. I always hated webmail because of its slow speed. But this seems blazing fast compared to any webmail I've used so far. So should you believe the hype? So far Gmail is by invitation only so unless you know someone who can give you one, I think you can wait. I am not one who also uses webmail frequently but I'll wait 'til my gmail emails increase and I'll see whether its worth it or not. But for now, please email me at urlLink noelperlas@gmail.com (I guess it carries some prestige to be able to have a by invitation only email)
